applicants.Name: Chitwan Goel
Experience: AI Intern, AI Northstar Tech
(May ’23 - Jul ’23 )
• Conducted extensive research on state-of-the-art AI techniques, and used it to solve real-world problems
• Curated terabyte-scale image dataset through web scraping using Selenium, for multiple semantic search engines
• Developed a prototype web app for searching and browsing the dataset using images and text as input
• Integrated embeddings from large multi-modal models like CLIP, and transformer models like ViT, into
the prototype, using Huggingface hub and transformers library
Full Stack Developer Intern, Vizuara
(Mar ’23 - Jul ’23 )
• Developed a full-stack MERN course portal, featuring integrated payment gateway and user authentication
• Implemented a search system using TensorFlow.js, enabling advanced search based on semantic understanding
• Automated an uploading process to Firebase, drastically reducing the time required from hours to seconds
• Created an innovative resume generation portal utilizing AI and human expertise for polished resumes
Projects: CSE Bubble (cid:135) (CS220 Course Project)
Mentor: Professor Urbi Chatterjee (CSE, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur)
(Mar ’23 - Apr ’23 )
• Implemented CSE-BUBBLE processor with separate 32-bit sized Instruction and Data Memory sections
• Developed op-code formats and modules for instruction handling, including ALU and branching operations
• Generated machine code for Bubble Sort from MIPS code, and stored output in data memory through simulation
What’s Next (cid:135) (CS253 Course Project)
Mentor: Professor Indranil Saha (CSE, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur)
(Jan ’23 - Apr ’23 )
• Developed an event management MERN app for IITK, featuring registration, like/dislike functionality & notification
• Created an intuitive interface with interactive elements like event details pages, and personalized user dashboards
• Integrated a payment portal enabling organizers to make direct seamless payments to Lecture Hall Complex
Jal Jeevan Mission (Water-Life Mission)
Mentor: Professor Priyanka Bagade (CSE, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur)
(Nov ’22 - Apr ’23 )
• Contributed to a government-funded project addressing water pipe leakage detection using sensors and hydrophones
• Extensively analyzed state-of-the-art techniques and integrated hardware and software approaches in the project
• Simulated a water pipeline to collect data and employed KNN-SVM ensemble methods, for accurate predictions
Position of responsibilities: • Leading the website development as Web Head at Techkriti, IITK, providing guidance to the team of executives
• Coordinated internship and placement drive of more than 2000 students as Company Coordinator at SPO, IITK

applicants.Name: SPANDAN SENAPATI
applicants.Degree: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering
Experience: • Algorithms in Depth
Programming Club, IIT Kanpur
May’19 - July’19
– Studied various graph algorithms such as Dijkstra, Bellman Ford, Kruskal’s and Prim, Disjoint Set Union (DSU) etc
– Studied and implemented various advanced data structures such as Segment Trees, Fenwick Trees etc
• Among top 1% Indians on Codechef with a 5* rating of 2022 and an active participation in contests
Projects: • Bayesian Tensor Completion for Traﬃc Estimation
Supervisor: Prof. Ketan Rajawat
Aug’19 - Nov’19
– Worked on Streaming Tensor Factorisation and Bayesian Subspace Filtering using Mean Field Variational Inference
– Extended the idea to Traﬃc estimation on a dynamic setting giving the ﬂexibility to handle multiple relationships in dataset
– Derived theoretical results on the proposed algorithm and studied techniques (LDL Decomp) to improve the time complexity
Jan’20 - Apr’20
• Robust Principal Component Analysis(Course Project)
Supervisor: Prof. Ketan Rajawat
– Studied and worked on eﬃcient algorithms for RPCA and Convex Optimisation in Linear programming problems
– Proposed modiﬁcations as stimulations involving randomized estimators to handle the computational eﬃciencies
– Carried experiments to compare performances of Proximal Gradient Algorithms with existing optimisers in Pytorch
May’19 - July’19
• Probabilistic Machine Learning
Programming Club, IIT Kanpur
– Implemented a Numpy based model for density estimation using Gaussian Mixture model on MNIST dataset
– Explored advances in Variational Inference such as Stochastic VI, BBVI, Variational Autoencoders (VAE)
– Explored advances in MCMC methods such as Hamiltonian MCMC (HMC), Langevin Dynamics etc
Courses: Data Structures and Algorithms Discrete Mathematics
Position of responsibilities: • Student Guide - Counselling Service, IIT Kanpur
July’19 - Present
– Responsible for the guidance and mentorship at a personal level of 5 freshman undergraduates and for the smooth conduction
of various events in the Orientation Session for the incoming Batch of Y19
Extracurricular Activities
• Mentor - Association for Computing Activities (ACA), IIT Kanpur
Jan’20 - Mar’20
– Mentored a group of 10 students on Probabilistic Machine Learning (PML) by introducing them to the ﬁeld
– Organised lectures and prepared monthly theoretical and programming assignments to check their progress
i

applicants.Name: Prince Pratap
Skills: Basic Statistic, Data Analysis and Inference
Experience: • Research Intern at Angel Broking Pvt. Ltd.
– Formulated crossover and breakout strategy based on MA and MACD indicators in python
– Backtested and analyzed the strategies on portfolio of stocks on last 20 years end of day data
– Worked on the optimization of strategy involving around 500 combinations of time window and
came up with the time window with optimal metric
• Sub Head , Strategy Development at Metvy Net Pvt. Ltd.
– Spearheaded the 1st edition of Metvy Case Study Challenge generating revenue of Rs 20,300
– Outperformed and promoted to Sub-head in a span of one month
– Explored multiple revenue models pertaining to how various business ﬁrms run their business
– Actively involved in cost modelling and strategizing exercises to supply fresh ideas on fund raising
Projects: • Summer Project: Portfolio Optimization Using ML Models
(Summer Project 2019 )
Mentor: Finance Discussion Group, IITK
– Employed various data cleaning techniques for feature selection from the given dataset and scraped the
stock data of companies from various sectors to eliminate the speciﬁc risk of the portfolio
– Applied modern portfolio theory to achieve the optimal weights for maximum sharpe ratio and
minimum variance portfolios
– Achieved an accuracy of 92% to generate optimal weights for a group of assets and mean squared
error of 0.77 in predicting the stock prices using various ML models
Position of responsibilities: • Attended workshop on data analytics and quantitative aptitude by Prepleaf
• Participant of volleyball team in Institute Summer Sports Camp 2019
• Represented the school as a part of school volleyball team in CBSE clusters 2017
i

applicants.Name: Sampada Sinha
Skills: • Programming Languages: C, C++, MATLAB, Python • Utilities: MySQL, Tensorﬂow, Scikit-learn, MS Excel, LATEX
Experience: Detection of Heavy Metals, SURGE’20 | Prof Siddhartha Panda
July’20-Present
Projects: Image Processing in Finance | Finance and Analytics Club
May’20-July’20
Emotion Recognition | Brain and Cognitive Society
* Predicted and analysed the future returns of a stock by implementing CNN Model using extracted time-series data
* Labelled data as buy, sell or hold and created images from time series using the normalised values of technical parameters
* Evaluated performance of CNN by two diﬀerent criteria: Computational Model Performance and Financial Evaluation
* Superimposed the proposed model on a single stock (Axis Bank) to analyse performance on the real world ﬁnancial scenario
May’20-July’20
* Detected involuntary emotional response occurring with conﬂicting emotions using Facial Expression to identify true emotion
* Implemented attentional neural network and obtained an accuracy of 56.98% on FER2013 dataset and 60% on JAFFE dataset
* Ensembled CNNs consisiting of 5 trained and 2 custom models that were least correlated and represented second network
* Improved accuracy of FER2013 dataset to 76.86% and JAFFE dataset to 97.14% using ensemble network of CNN models
Position of Responsibility
UG Academics Manager | Academics and Career Council
Apr’20-Present
Courses: Applied Probability and Statistics, Fundamentals of Computing, Linear Algebra and Diﬀerential Equation,
Neural Networks and Deep Learning*, Python Financial Analytics*
Engineering Computational Methods in Engineering, Manufacturing Processes (I and II), Introduction to Electronics
Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics, Fluid Mechanics, Process Calculation

Student Guide: Mentored 5 students on emotional and academic fronts for smooth transition in college.

Senior Writer, Vox Populi: Discussed and wrote articles about opportunities and obstacles related to campus
